jǐng
neck
шея
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 颈)
Pictophonetic: 巠 (head) indicates the sound; 頁 conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
頸項 [ jǐng xiàng ]: neck
頸椎 [ jǐng zhuī ]: cervical vertebra; the seven cervical vertebrae in the neck of humans and most mammals
頸椎病 [ jǐng zhuī bìng ]: cervical spondylosis

    • 巠 [ jīng ] underground river; flowing water
    • 頁 [ yè ] page, sheet, leaf
heisig_chinese_memo: Some African cultures have cool fashion styles like ladies with almost bald heads and a neck which looks like a spool for gold rings.

gěng: (графема) шея (разг., используется только в слове 脖颈儿)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the one wavy river working (巠) by the page (頁) is the throat
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Some African cultures have cool fashion style like ladies with almost bald heads and a neck which looks like a spool for gold rings.
humanum_full_description_en:
From " page ", "巠" sound, the original meaning is the part that connects the head and the torso. Bronze writing is used as the name of the person. Uncle Youfu Plate (Mid Spring and Autumn Period): "Yu (only) Ji Dinghai in early June, Majing Junbai (Bo) Yufu Zha (made) Qimo plate." Said Majingjun Uncle Yufu Cast a pan to wash your face. "Shuowen": "Head and stem also. From the page, the sound." The original meaning is common in classics, such as "Zuo Zhuan‧Dinggong Fourteen Years": "Make the sinner three lines, belong to the sword at the neck." "First": "Qin prince Ying car and white horse, tie the neck to form a group." Tang Dynasty Han Yu "Send Qiongwen": "The hair is all upright, the shoulders shrink and the neck." The original meaning is also used in the silk and silk texts, such as "Sleeping Tiger Land" Qin Jian. Japanese Book A Type "Simplified 151zheng-2": "The one who clamps the neck is expensive. The one under the foot is cheap." "Sleeping Tiger Land Qin Slips. Japanese Book A Type" Jane 35 back-2: "Prick his neck with a good sword."

An object like the neck of a human body is also called the neck. For example, in "Zhou Li·Kao Gong Ji·Yi Ren": "Participate the rabbit circumference, and go to the neck circumference." Zheng Xuan's note: "The neck is the one who holds the balance. Dai Fengshao's "Feng's Scriptures-Car System": "The one who drives the horse and leads the car is called the squat, and the one who hooks and weighs before the squad is called the neck."
humanum_short_description_en: From " page ", "巠" sound, the original meaning is the part that connects the head and the torso.
humanum_full_description:
從「頁」，「巠」聲，本義為頭部與軀幹連接的部分。金文用作人名，伯遊父盤（春秋中期）：「隹（唯）六月初吉丁亥，馬頸君白（伯）遊父乍（作）其沫盤。」表示馬頸君伯遊父鑄造了用來洗臉的盤。《說文》：「頭莖也。从頁，巠聲。」典籍常見本義，如《左傳‧定公十四年》：「使罪人三行，屬劍於頸。」《漢書‧高帝紀上》：「秦王子嬰素車白馬，係頸以組。」唐代韓愈〈送窮文〉：「毛髮盡豎，竦肩縮頸。」 簡帛文字也用此本義，如《睡虎地秦簡．日書甲種》簡151正-2：「夾頸者貴。在足下者賤。」《睡虎地秦簡．日書甲種》簡35背-2：「以良劍刺其頸」。

　　像人體頸部的物體也稱頸，如《周禮‧考工記‧輈人》：「參分其兔圍，去一以為頸圍。」鄭玄注：「頸，前持衡者。」清代鳳韶《鳳氏經說‧車制》：「駕馬引車者曰輈，輈之前鉤衡者曰頸。」
humanum_short_description: 從「頁」，「巠」聲，本義為頭部與軀幹連接的部分。

頸 (Simplified: 颈)
Pinyin: jǐng
English Definition: neck
Total strokes: 16; Radical: 頁
Pictophonetic: 巠 (head) indicates the sound; 頁 conveys the meaning.
Character Formation:
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 巠 [ jīng ] underground river; flowing water
    • 頁 [ yè ] page, sheet, leaf
Example Words:
頸項 [ jǐng xiàng ]: neck
頸椎 [ jǐng zhuī ]: cervical vertebra; the seven cervical vertebrae in the neck of humans and most mammals
頸椎病 [ jǐng zhuī bìng ]: cervical spondylosis
More: 頸* | *頸 | *頸*

從「 頁 」，「 巠 」聲，本義為頭部與軀幹連接的部分。金文用作人名，伯遊父盤（春秋中期）：「隹（唯）六月初吉丁亥，馬頸君白（伯）遊父乍（作）其沫盤。」表示馬頸君伯遊父鑄造了用來洗臉的盤。《說文》：「頭莖也。从頁，巠聲。」典籍常見本義，如《左傳‧定公十四年》：「使罪人三行，屬劍於頸。」《漢書‧高帝紀上》：「秦王子嬰素車白馬，係頸以組。」唐代韓愈〈送窮文〉：「毛髮盡豎，竦肩縮頸。」 簡帛文字也用此本義，如《睡虎地秦簡．日書甲種》簡151正-2：「夾頸者貴。在足下者賤。」《睡虎地秦簡．日書甲種》簡35背-2：「以良劍刺其頸」。 像人體頸部的物體也稱頸，如《周禮‧考工記‧輈人》：「參分其兔圍，去一以為頸圍。」鄭玄注：「頸，前持衡者。」清代鳳韶《鳳氏經說‧車制》：「駕馬引車者曰輈，輈之前鉤衡者曰頸。」

頸字的基本解释

頸
jǐng

頸字的汉语字典释义

[①]［jǐng］
［《廣韻》居郢切，上静，見。］
［《廣韻》巨成切，平清，見。］
“颈1”的繁体字。亦作“頚1”。亦作“鵛1”。
(1)颈项。头部与躯干连接的部分。又称脖子。
(2)指物体像人体颈部的部位。
(3)引颈。谓仰慕、期待。
(4)径直；直接。
(5)星名。
[②]［gěng］
“颈2”的繁体字。亦作“頚2”。亦作“鵛2”。
见“脖頸”。

頸字的康熙字典解释

【戌集下】【頁字部】　頸； 康熙笔画：16； 页码：页1405第14
【唐韻】居郢切【集韻】【韻會】經郢切【正韻】居影切，?音景。【說文】頭莖也。【釋名】頸，徑也，徑挺而長也。【廣韻】頸在前，項在後。【禮·玉藻】頭頸必中。　又凡物之領皆曰頸。【禮·玉藻】韠其頸五寸。【註】頸，中央也。　又【史記·天官書】七星頸爲員官，主急事。【正義】七星爲頸，一名天都，以明爲吉，暗爲凶。宋均云：頸，朱鳥頸也。　又【周禮·冬官考工記·輈人】參分其兔圍，去一以爲頸圍。五分其頸圍，去一以爲踵圍。【註】頸，前持衡者。踵，後承軫者也。　又【廣韻】巨成切，音?。義同。

考證：〔【史記·天官書】七星頸爲負官，主急事。〕　謹照原文負官改員官。

暂无。

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［jǐng］
["Guangyun" Ju Yingqie, Shangjing, see you. ]
["Guangyun" is a huge cut, calm and clear, see you. ]
Traditional Chinese characters for "领1". Also known as "頚1". Also known as "鵛1".
(1) Neck. The part where the head connects to the torso. Also known as the neck.
(2) Refers to the part where the object resembles the neck of the human body.
(3) Lead the neck. It means admiration and expectation.
(4) Straight; direct.
(5) Star name.
[②]［gěng］
Traditional Chinese characters for "neck 2". Also known as "頚2". Also known as "鵛2".
See "neck".
